articles.title: U Can Study Blonde: Elle Woods Goes Gaucho for Fashion Merchandising Ph.D.
articles.description: After completing a campus visit and tour yesterday, Harvard Law graduate and political activist Elle Woods made her decision to enroll at UC Santa Barbara official by submitting her statement of inten...
articles.content:
Jenny De La Cuadra / Daily Nexus

After completing a campus visit and tour yesterday, Harvard Law graduate and political activist Elle Woods made her decision to enroll at UC Santa Barbara official by submitting her statement of intent to register. With an already impressive resume and educational background, Woods stated that pursuing her next degree will be another ‚Äútotally great‚Äù endeavor.

‚ÄúEver since I started working in Washington, I‚Äôve been thinking about my next career move,‚Äù said Woods as she posed in front of the art department‚Äôs mural for a photo. ‚ÄúEducation has always been a top priority for me, and UCSB‚Äôs stellar reputation really appealed to me.‚Äù

Woods will be the first student to enroll in the newly formed Department of Fashion Merchandising in the College of Letters and Science, representing another groundbreaking innovation for UCSB‚Äôs educational offerings.

View this post on Instagram

"In diversity there is beauty and there is strength." üåà #MayaAngelou üì∏: @avaphillippe

A post shared by Reese Witherspoon (@reesewitherspoon) on Feb 1, 2017 at 10:15am PST

The CULA alum spoke about how much she missed California during her time on the east coast, but wanted a change of scenery when she finally returned. ‚ÄúI kept hearing about all the things Santa Barbara is known for: the beach, the parties, its six Nobel Laureates and its competitive national ranking as a top public university. I knew for sure it would be the perfect fit when I saw its diverse blonde population!‚Äù

Woods says she has big plans for the upcoming school year, some of which include leading research projects based on her thesis examining the effects of half-loop stitching on low viscosity rayon and establishing the first UCSB chapter of the Delta Nu sorority.

¬†

Jasmine Vaughn is a third-year communication major who‚Äôs graduating early because what, like it‚Äôs hard?

articles.title: New Plans to Deal With DP Cliff-Slide Risk
articles.description: Recent events surrounding the cliffslide and mandatory demolition at 6653 Del Playa have seen a shift in the design philosophy of oceanside property owners.
articles.content:
Nathan Campos / Daily Nexus

The recent events surrounding the cliffslide and mandatory demolition at 6653 Del Playa have seen a shift in the design philosophy held by owners of oceanside properties. The incident caused not only a major inconvenience to its former tenants who were forced to move, but was also a sizable cost to its owner. In order to better ensure the safety and longevity of oceanfront real estate, it seems that property owners and management groups are resorting to more extreme tactics.

These extreme tactics, it appears, embrace the idea of the homes sliding into the ocean as a benefit more than a potential downside. This new strategy is reflected in blueprints that have been submitted to the local planning office for approval.¬†These blueprints show digitally rendered images of a two-story duplex, replete with floatation, pontoons and oars. Additionally the cliffside nearby will be retrofitted to support a Slip ‚ÄòN Slide in order to allow easy beach access for tenants on good days or soft entry into the sea for the entire duplex when that becomes necessary.

According to UCSB geography professor Ashley Dorfman, this type of planning should be of concern to local residents.¬†In reply to our email requesting her input, she stated, ‚ÄúAny attempt at trying to capitalize on the inherently unstable nature of the cliffs along Del Playa is incredibly risky, without precedent and should be rejected.‚Äù

Her fears of the danger that may surround the proposed new duplexes were not echoed by current Isla Vista resident Bob Guiney. The second-year chemical engineering student told us, ‚ÄúLook, all those houses are gonna end up in the water soon enough anyway. You may as well just accept it and plan ahead.‚Äù

Sources close to the developers of these properties claim that the owners are doing this as part of a change in position from saying that cliffslides are ‚Äúhazards‚Äù to their current view of them as ‚Äúfeatures.‚Äù¬†Critics from the Isla Vista Tenants Union say these ‚Äúupgrades‚Äù are really just a cover to turn duplexes into houseboats in order to be able to charge more in rent since the properties will now additionally be classified as ‚Äúamphibious vehicles.‚Äù

¬†

Jenny is praying to the Sea gods that her overcrowded apartment on Trigo becomes beachfront property by next year.

Print

articles.title: Putin Hacks Starbucks, Students Rejoice Over Free Lattes
articles.description: ‚ÄúIt actually wasn‚Äôt that bad for me,‚Äù Starbucks barista Denise Gates said. ‚ÄúMany people tried to make up for it in tips so I counted myself lucky to be working that shift.‚Äù
articles.content:
Alex Ngase / Daily Nexus

On Thursday evening a cyber attack targeting Starbucks franchises across America resulted in thousands of beverages being given away at no cost to consumers. At approximately 4:30 p.m., a call was made to corporate headquarters alleging that cash registers were only totaling zero. The company‚Äôs chief technology officer Bernard Hobbs reportedly told cashiers to simply ‚Äúgo with it.‚Äù Now intelligence officials are reporting that they traced the hack back to the Kremlin. ¬†

‚ÄúIt actually wasn‚Äôt that bad for me,‚Äù Starbucks barista Denise Gates said. ‚ÄúMany people tried to make up for it in tips so I counted myself lucky to be working that shift.‚Äù The coffee conglomerate has not stated how much the two-hour long glitch cost them. However, officials told the Daily Nexus they planned to make up for the deficit this coming autumn.

‚ÄúI thought it was about time,‚Äù Jacqueline Rowe, an unknown artist and self-proclaimed hipster, said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been pouring money into this corporation for years; finally they‚Äôve poured me a free drink. Maybe Putin isn‚Äôt such a bad guy after all.‚Äù The Russian ambassador claimed he had no idea what might have motivated the attack.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think this was a Russian job,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe do not take a liking to Starbucks, but certainly President Putin has more important things to do than to target a glorified drug dealer.‚Äù

¬†

Emily Anne Williams is a second-year linguistics major who is addicted to caffeine but can‚Äôt comprehend spending six dollars on an American cup with an Italian size name.

Print

articles.title: Local Girl Arrested in Relation to Spoon Homicide
articles.description: ‚ÄúShe had it coming! I warned her, but that spoon was still in the sink when I got home.‚Äù
articles.content:
Courtesy of Sarah Wilkerson

ISLA VISTA, CA ‚Äî A third-year UCSB student was arrested last night for the Jan. 5 murder of her roommate, Kelly Lark. The damning evidence was found in the form of a series of incriminating sticky notes found on the girls‚Äô fridge. The notes can be used to mark the trajectory of the events leading up to the homicide, with the earliest dating Oct. 15.

One read, ‚ÄúKelly, if you could wash your bowl when you get home, that would be great.‚Äù The last note was left just a day before the murder and read, ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt do your fucking dishes, I‚Äôm going to kill you.‚Äù

The victim was found at 9 p.m. Jan. 5 with a spoon ‚Äî the alleged murder weapon ‚Äî shoved through the her eye. No other injuries were found on the body, and the coroners ruled the cause of death to be penetrating trauma.

When police arrived to arrest the suspect, she reportedly shouted, ‚ÄúShe had it coming! I warned her, but that spoon was still in the sink when I got home.‚Äù The suspect is currently being held and will stand trial on Feb. 15.

The victim‚Äôs family will be holding a memorial service on Feb. 1 at the UCSB commencement lawn. They kindly ask attendees not to bring any cutlery.

¬†

Zoey Brandt is a third-year English major. She is very thankful that her apartment has a dishwasher.

Print

articles.title: Raccoon Trash Lord Grows Stronger Every Time You Litter
articles.description: Juniper‚Äôs origin is unknown, but what is known is that he controls the greater Isla Vista area through his networks of trash.
articles.content:
Roberto Solano / Daily Nexus

ISLA VISTA ‚Äî After months of extensive research and hardcore investigative journalism, the truth behind the trash epidemic of Isla Vista has been exposed. There is a raccoon that travels as a renegade throughout I.V. followed by his ravenous band of raccoon disciples. He acts as the Trash Lord, and he grows stronger every single time you litter. His name is Juniper, and he will fuck you up.

Juniper‚Äôs origin is unknown, but what is known is that he controls the greater Isla Vista area through his networks of trash. When you litter, you shamelessly contribute to his dominion, essentially putting the metaphorical key to I.V. in his tiny raccoon hand.

While a raccoon may not seem very threatening when standing in the shadow of man, Juniper holds much more power than one might initially assume. Once he grew physically strong enough to gain power over all the other raccoons, he set his sight on his next target: college students. We believe he targets students so he can acquire their trash. The trash makes him stronger and hungrier, thus engaging him in an infinite quest for power.

He began his takeover by organizing his ravenous raccoon disciples (also referred to as the ‚ÄúRavCoons‚Äù) to attack individuals, eventually working up to small groups of defenseless students and even entire houses. When he was just starting out, he would even perform some of these attacks personally.

Security cameras have caught Juniper on multiple occasions stealing skateboards directly out from under students and then throwing them into the ocean. He once was reported to take a bite out of a skateboard before disposing of it. As to why he did this, we are still unsure. We believe it was a power play to assert his dominance and establish a reputation before organizing larger attacks.

Once he gained enough momentum, he would send the RavCoons on rampages to bike racks all over campus and through I.V., commanding them to shred all the tires and eat all of the bike seats in sight. This left students immobile and susceptible to more attacks.

If anyone is a known enemy of Juniper, be aware that he will strategically send the RavCoons to pee in your backpack or car. Known enemies are typically anyone who recycles. ‚ÄúHe ate my Android,‚Äù victim and second-year sociology major Kenneth Walker cried. ‚ÄúHe swallowed it whole!‚Äù Walker had been petitioning for a better recycling system in I.V., making him Juniper‚Äôs top enemy at the time.

To optimize your personal safety, you must be able to identify Trash Lord Juniper. He is much larger in build and fluffier than all the other raccoons, which constantly surround him for protection. He also always wears his signature pair of red Adidas track pants, and he loves it when you call him Big Poppa. If he approaches you, say, ‚ÄúBig Poppa Juniper, take my trash in peace,‚Äù and he will spare you.

Juniper was last seen chewing up the aux cord at a party. Stay safe, Isla Vista, and, for the life of you, don‚Äôt litter.
Ariana Marmolejo is the Trash Lord of her own personal dominion. Respect to Juniper.

Print
Ariana Marmolejo

Ariana Marmolejo serves as the Nexustentialism Editor and spends her days making bad to moderately good jokes. She formally requests that any anonymous hate comments be sent to her directly via email at nexustentialism@dailynexus.com.

articles.title: Trump Appoints Stanford Tree Head of U.S. Forest Service
articles.description: ‚ÄúThis is a guy who knows trees and the problems that they face,‚Äù said President Trump.
articles.content:
Irvin Tang / Daily Nexus

As the first week of Trump‚Äôs presidency progresses, he is expected to fill several important positions. He did just that Sunday night when he signed the paperwork to allow the prestigious mascot of Stanford to take the role of U.S. Forest Service Chief.

‚ÄúThis is a guy who knows trees and the problems that they face,‚Äù said President Trump. ‚ÄúI look forward to working with him to improve the health of our nation‚Äôs forests.‚Äù

Although Stanford Tree did not issue a statement, several UCSB students came forward with their thoughts and opinions.

‚ÄúThis is insane,‚Äù said Allison Reynolds, a fourth-year environmental studies major. ‚ÄúHe had so many decent people to pick from, but he picked a plant. I get that it‚Äôs fitting and all, but I foresee a lot of communication issues in the future.‚Äù

Third-year political science major Jamal Winston disagreed.

‚ÄúThe core promise of Trump‚Äôs campaign was to shrink the federal government. The forest service is one of those departments no one cares about. No one even knows what they do. It‚Äôs just something for the government to pat themselves on the back for. Hopefully this will reduce spending in that area.‚Äù

There are many more seats to be filled as Congress continues to vet the candidates this week.

Emily Anne Williams is a second-year linguistics major who is sick of hearing how this batch of bureaucrats is supposedly worse than the last one. ¬†

Print

articles.title: Chancellor Yang Washed Away by Floods
articles.description: It would appear that he first got caught in the flood around Storke Tower and has since been seen floating down Del Playa, holding on to a rogue surfboard.
articles.content:
Courtesy of Brittany Nguyen

After intense rainfall and mass flash flood warnings, it appears that one person within the UCSB community was not aware of the potential dangers that the storms have created. It was confirmed by authorities that Chancellor Henry T. Yang has been caught in the rainwater and washed away with the flood. His location is currently unknown, and all of the university‚Äôs resources have gone to finding him and bringing him home safely.

His wife, Dilling Yang, was the one to first report the unfortunate accident. Since he was washed away, she has been home, minding her business as usual. When asked for comment, she simply stated, ‚Äúhe does this every time it floods. I am not concerned.‚Äù

It would appear that he first got caught in the flood around Storke Tower and has since been seen floating down Del Playa, holding on to a rogue surfboard.

‚ÄúHa ha, yeah, I thought I saw Chancellor Yang floating down DP,‚Äù stated fourth-year global studies major Matt Williams, a resident of the 66 block. ‚ÄúI thought I was tripping, so I went back to bed.‚Äù

This is the only lead authorities currently have.

According to an inside source within the fire department, he usually washes up safely around Sands Beach, where he likes to admire the tide pools until someone comes to pick him up. There are emergency personnel groups currently stationed along the beach, waiting with blankets and hot cocoa for when Yang appears. They have been instructed to let him look at the sea anemones before bringing him home. Updates on Yang‚Äôs whereabouts to continue.

¬†

Ariana Marmolejo enjoys swimming in floodwater and splashing in puddles.

Print
Ariana Marmolejo

Ariana Marmolejo serves as the Nexustentialism Editor and spends her days making bad to moderately good jokes. She formally requests that any anonymous hate comments be sent to her directly via email at nexustentialism@dailynexus.com.

articles.title: Satan Declines Invitation to Trump Inauguration
articles.description: ‚ÄúI was told that ‚Äòliterally Hitler‚Äô would be sworn in. I know Hitler; he‚Äôs a good friend of mine. This guy is no Hitler; he doesn‚Äôt even have the mustache,‚Äù
articles.content:
Courtesy of TMZ.com

The gatekeeper to the underworld shocked everyone this week after he announced that he would not be attending President-elect Donald Trump‚Äôs inauguration on Friday. He cited communication issues as the reason he had RSVP‚Äôd earlier.

‚ÄúI was told that ‚Äòliterally Hitler‚Äô would be sworn in. I know Hitler; he‚Äôs a good friend of mine. This guy is no Hitler; he doesn‚Äôt even have the mustache,‚Äù Satan said in a press conference held at his summer home in Death Valley, Calif.

On the other hand, President-elect Trump claims to have no knowledge of how Satan even got on the guest list.

‚ÄúI have never had contact with this person. I don‚Äôt know how he got on the list. I am going to personally look into it and make sure all inauguration guests are thoroughly vetted from now on,‚Äù Trump said.

Some students are relieved by Satan‚Äôs snub of the future president, but others are worried.

‚ÄúThe future leader of the U.S. can‚Äôt even get someone who hangs out with dead guys to come to his inauguration, so how is he supposed to maneuver foreign relations?‚Äù Sal Jones, a third-year political science and feminist studies double major, said.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre all worried,‚Äù economics Professor Ralph Warren added, ‚Äúbut the man who presides over Hell isn‚Äôt exactly someone we should form our opinions on.‚Äù

¬†

Emily Anne Williams is a second-year linguistics major who will probably be in class during this important transition of power.

Print

articles.title: Local Gluten-Free Crossfit Trainer Takes Vow of Silence, Leaves Scientific Community Uprooted
articles.description: In what will certainly go down as a cornerstone development of the 21st century, scientists at the University of Science in Siberia met Monday morning to discuss the unthinkable.
articles.content:
Peyton Stotelmyre / Daily Nexus

In what will certainly go down as a cornerstone development of the 21st century, scientists at the University of Science in Siberia met Monday morning to discuss the unthinkable. ¬†¬†¬†

Various heads of state were also in attendance, promoting the gathering to a summit of scientific sorts; talks revolved around a recent development in our very own local tri-state area. To be precise, a gluten-free vegan crossfit trainer named Mystica Seven announced last Saturday evening that she would be embarking on a lengthy bout of silence due to Donald Trump‚Äôs inauguration on Dec. 20.

She took to popular livestreaming app Periscope to issue this official statement and did so after a relatively turbulent diatribe during which she asserted, in part, ‚ÄúIt just really bothers me that when you photoshop his mouth onto his eyes, his face still looks the same.‚Äù

As for the exact length of her elective silence, she said, ‚ÄúI‚Äôll decide once I read my Daily Nexus horoscope.‚Äù

Despite the impressively political nature of the stand Seven is taking, Monday‚Äôs meeting focused more so on the biology of the individual in question.

‚ÄúWe believe Seven is, to put it bluntly, a superhuman,‚Äù head scientist Roam Margo said at the press conference directly following the meeting. ‚ÄúWe know of no other case in which someone with her credentials ‚Äî gluten-free, vegan, crossfit trainer ‚Äî has been able to refrain from speaking about said credentials for more than 34 seconds.‚Äù He went on to say, ‚ÄúWe have come to the conclusion that she is a descendant of either Zeus or John Stamos.‚Äù

A source close to Seven, who has since been dubbed ‚ÄúWoke Jesus‚Äù by nonpartisan news outlets like Teen Vogue and The Guardian, is convinced that she may also be a free-trade advocate. According to Margo, this pending discovery ‚Äúmakes her vow of silence all the more mystifying.‚Äù When asked whether he or she would be accompanying Seven on her wordless journey, the source said, ‚ÄúI really would if I could, but I do a lot of bikram yoga.‚Äù

Margo ended Monday‚Äôs press conference by taking a few questions, perhaps the most poignant of which came courtesy of The Daily Daily‚Äôs Sempris Hergesheimer.

‚ÄúDo you plan to assemble a rough-and-tumble task force with Seven at the helm in order to clean both the domestic and international streets of crime?‚Äù Hergesheimer said.

After a brief pause, Margo calmly responded.

‚ÄúFor matters of homeland security, I am not exactly at the liberty to say, but know this: We have reached out to Woke Jesus. Of course, the nature of her political stand makes it difficult to contact her, but among other things, we have set up a heavy duty line of grande mocha ice blendeds stretching from her house to the university. She will most likely reach the university in 24 to 78 hours, at which point we will begin analyzing her genome and such in order to get a better grip on the situation.‚Äù

For up-to-the-minute developments on this story and more, head to the Daily Nexus‚Äô match.com dating profile.

¬†

When he‚Äôs not drinking kombucha whilst hot sauna-ing away his deepest desires, Jake can be found in a meditative trance somewhere along the I-5.

Print

articles.title: Top 7 Internships For College Students in 2017
articles.description:
Internships.

The elusive, ever ethereal precursors to one‚Äôs midsummer night‚Äôs dream job on Mount Olympus with froyo on tap.
articles.content:
Courtesy of Aptech

Internships.

The elusive, ever ethereal precursors to one‚Äôs midsummer night‚Äôs dream job on Mount Olympus with froyo on tap. We at Nexustentialism understand how hard it is to find them, and we also know how much students at UCSB want and need them. With this in mind and comprehensive research under my belt, I have compiled an utterly exhaustive list detailing the top seven internships available right now in and around the area:

¬†

  1. Seventeen Magazine subscription renewer

Buy Magazines and Stuff Emporium, located at the southeast corner of Placenta and Pico Place, is actively looking for dedicated full-time interns interested in renewing these aforementioned subscriptions. BMSE‚Äôs triennial newsletter states that interns are expected to ‚Äúsneak into the houses of local Seventeen Magazine subscribers, gather the necessary info and quickly re-subscribe for them.‚Äù

¬†

  1. Russian computer keyboard maker

Super Russian Computer Co-Op, located between Taco Bell and RadioShack on Steet Street, is actively looking for emotionally invested part-time interns/CEOs to spearhead its keyboard manufacturing division. SRCC‚Äôs bidaily manifesto asserts that ‚Äúkeyboard makers are handsomely paid in Trident Layers and will be the very last in line in the event we require sacrifices to our Karl Marx statue in the back.‚Äù

¬†

  1. Unsalted pretzel salter

Various startups in the greater Southern California region are blazing the trail for a new wave in the service industry: unsalted pretzel salting. Hollywood B to C listers have resorted to the pretty sketch Somali black market for their collective salt fix, but they need not fear any longer. One company in particular, Salt That Shit Initiative, has 73 spots available for eager interns-to-be like yourself. It should be noted that STSI has a strict ‚Äúno glasses‚Äù policy.

¬†

  1. Shift manager at the Subway Pizza Hut on Fourth and Jesus Christ Jessica Open Your Eyes He‚Äôs Using You Lane

Located on Fourth and Jesus Christ Jessica Open Your Eyes He‚Äôs Using You Lane, the Subway Pizza Hut is home to all your wildest intern fantasies. As per the establishment‚Äôs Grindr profile, ‚ÄúInterns are to be prepared for anything and everything, including but not limited to: giving, receiving, inserting, and excreting receipts, orders, pizza sandwiches, and praise, respectively.‚Äù

¬†

  1. Democratic pollster pundits

The DNC is currently looking to fill every position after this year‚Äôs historical big-league upset. DNC operatives were supposed to send us more information, but something seemed to have happened with the email.

¬†

  1. Vox staff writers

See above.

¬†

  1. Fairtrade-Vegan-Microbrew-IPA-Grown-at-Elevation policy creator

Fairtrade-Vegan-Microbrew-IPA-Grown-at-Elevation Policy Creators International, or We‚Äôre Better Than You Peasants for short:

Imagine you‚Äôre in a fashionably lit basement hidden behind a moderately sized sub-Saharan tapestry. Jason Statham walks in, except he‚Äôs actually Tom Brady. He mouths something to you in what seems to be another language; you‚Äôre confused yet comforted. Seconds after your intimate interaction, an armored vehicle bursts through the floor. You seize the opportunity and take off speed walking. Whilst briskly fleeing, you feel the heavy breathing of a passerby. It‚Äôs Maria Sharapova‚Äôs sister, Sandra Bullock, and she‚Äôs bundled up in several pairs of loose-fitting jeans and Anthropologie sweater-scarves made of the finest Rhodesian fabrics. ‚ÄúBut it‚Äôs hot outside,‚Äù you doth protest. Bullock replies, ‚ÄúIs it?‚Äù as she falls into the abyss above. It is at this point that you look down at your hands and realize they have been replaced with those of Shaquille O‚ÄôNeal. ‚ÄúI heard he‚Äôs a nice guy,‚Äù you think to yourself as a watermelon rolls down the narrow corridor. You narrowly evade the debatably citrus-like Afro-American staple and are instead hit in the face by a seismic epiphany:

I. Am. Asian.

This is exactly what you needed at this very moment. You calculate the exact polarity necessary for an effective overdrive measure. The Ewops are gaining. Just as you reach the frontal barricade of the maximum security prison, a child screams, ‚ÄúDaddy, wait!‚Äù You decide you must go back for your daughter, but Morgan Freeman interjects: ‚ÄúYOU FOOL! SHE‚ÄôS NOT REAL!‚Äù

He‚Äôs right. Using the Shaq hands you‚Äôve been blessed with, you hadouken through the steel gates and reach the exterior landing strip. With tears in your damaged robot eyes, you are met with the cold, cold reality that nothing is left of the outside world save for barren tundra and empty sustenance canisters from the Third Sector. Another realization washes over you: You‚Äôve been imprisoned for anywhere between 69 and 420 centuries. You want to end it all right then and there, but as you reach for the red tiger camo ACR with ACOG scope and a heartbeat sensor on the ground, a third and final thought occurs to you:

The. Fucking. Intern.

She made you a promise. You barrel roll into a nearby parking garage and ignite the fuse facilitator on the last remaining particle rover. You narrowly miss a life-altering roundhouse kick from the Ewopian Shadow General Mas Kudos and ride into the Lost Quadrant‚Äôs sunset with the intent of finding Lady Intern as the infamous prison planet of Farackas explodes in the periphery.

This is what it‚Äôs like to work with us. More or less. No promises.

¬†

When he‚Äôs not fending off Ewopian lab monkeys in Sector Five, Jake can be found taking a long walk on the beach whilst munching on a Buddha Bowl.

Print

articles.title: 10 Things the Elf on the Shelf Overheard During the Holidays
articles.description: This festive little buddy comes out to decorate the house with candy canes and lights and does more than just overlook from his perch.
articles.content:
Courtesy of dirtydiaperlaundry.com

The Elf on the Shelf is a holiday classic that typically sits in the living room overlooking all the family activities ‚Äî presumably on a nearby shelf. This festive little buddy comes out to decorate the house with candy canes and lights and does more than just overlook from his perch. He silently listens and judges every conversation when you think no one else is around. This holiday season, the Elf reported some of his favorite things he heard:

¬†

1. ‚ÄúHey sweetie, guess what I got you?‚Äù

‚ÄúIf it‚Äôs your junk in a box, George, I don‚Äôt want to see it‚Äù

2. ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs leave Santa an ice with his cookies. He‚Äôll have no choice but to drink it.‚Äù

3. ‚ÄúMom, what if Santa skips our house because dad is Jewish?‚Äù

4. ‚ÄúJim, if you label one more present ‚Äòto my favorite mistake‚Äô I swear.‚Äù

5. ‚ÄúMy mother-in-law really makes me want to spike my egg nog.‚Äù

6. ‚ÄúI love Christmas. It‚Äôs the one time of year I can buy myself whatever I want without Linda down the street judging me.‚Äù

7. ‚ÄúDessert doesn‚Äôt have calories on Christmas, right?‚Äù

8. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm re-gifting these shoes my son got me. I mean come on, blue is sooo last season. How can an eight-year-old not know that?‚Äù

9. ‚ÄúWait, what do you mean Kwanza isn‚Äôt a slang term for Christmas?‚Äù

10. ‚ÄúNew year, same me because you can‚Äôt get any better than perfect! *obnoxious laughter*‚Äù

¬†

Mia Roncati is a holiday fanatic who trusts no elf and fears no Santa.

Print

articles.title: 6 Trends That Need To Make a Comeback in 2017
articles.description: 2017 is the year we stop normalizing unrealistic stereotypical roles for minors so we can diversify our content and profit off of more child stars.
articles.content:
1. Chivalry

Courtesy of giphy.com

Thanks to the Feminist Movement, women‚Äôs rights have made strides of progress over the past century. But what about men? Too many independent and educated women can make some men feel excluded or useless, prompting chivalric codes to make a comeback for 2017. Complete with warrior ethos and manners, these medieval knighthood codes of conducts can make even the weakest of men feel useful to society again.

¬†

2. Common Sense

Courtesy of livelightheartedly.com

Regardless of which political party you belong to, everyone can agree that 2016 straight up lacked basic-ass common sense. From Ryan Lochte‚Äôs Rio shenanigans to Black-Friday-related homicides, human intelligence has decreased significantly and is seemingly being controlled by department store sales. As common sense hopes to make a 2017 comeback, prepare yourself by digging up your old APUSH binder and reading ‚ÄúCommon Sense‚Äù by Thomas Paine.

¬†

3. Minority Representation

Courtesy of giphy.com

It doesn‚Äôt take a genius to realize that mostly every person we see on television and adverts look exactly the same. Children make up a whopping 24 percent of the American population but only get cast in trivial and limited roles such as ‚Äúbaby‚Äù or ‚Äúkid playing in park.‚Äù 2017 is the year we stop normalizing unrealistic stereotypical roles for minors so we can diversify our content and profit off of more child stars.

¬†

4. Silly Bandz

Stan Lim / The Press Enterprise

Especially the elephant ones!!!1!1!!

¬†

5. Real News

Courtesy of reactiongifs.com

‚ÄúEvery time I read a Nexustentialism article I think it‚Äôs real news, but it‚Äôs not. It‚Äôs fake news.‚Äù

‚Äì UCSB student who doesn‚Äôt know shit

¬†

6. Human Rights

Courtesy of fusion.net

As the Islamic State selfishly claims all responsibility for the lack of human rights this year, it is worth noting that we, ourselves, are also to blame. Immersed in our world of ignorance and narcissism, we often forget there are actual breathing people living outside of our bubble. Acknowledge there are people in need that simply cannot be ignored any longer. Support a fellow human and make 2017 a better year.

¬†

Vianna Mabanag is a first-year English major who just wants 2016 to be over.

Print

articles.title: Santa Rescued from Sinking Sleigh by Heroic Surfers
articles.description: ‚ÄúAt first I couldn‚Äôt believe it,‚Äù second-year environmental studies Joseph Wilkins, one of the rescuers, said.
articles.content:
Sophie Sawyer & Sierra Deak / Daily Nexus

SANTA BARBARA, CA‚ÄîChaos almost ensued this Christmas Eve when a mechanical error caused Santa‚Äôs sleigh to plunge into the Pacific Ocean just off of Campus Point. Luckily, some UCSB students were enjoying a midnight surf when the reigns detached from the sled, rendering Old St. Nick flightless. Local students were able to pull him to shore without much trouble and, thankfully, no reindeer were harmed.

‚ÄúAt first I couldn‚Äôt believe it,‚Äù second-year environmental studies Joseph Wilkins, one of the rescuers, said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve wanted to spot the guy since I was a kid, I didn‚Äôt think it would happen like this.‚Äù

The students then treated the Christmas icon to a bite to eat while he waited for his replacement sled to arrive.

‚ÄúWe did what all college students do in a time of crisis, we went to Freebirds,‚Äù third-year philosophy major Mario Moreno said.

Santa reportedly ordered a quesarito and two servings of nachos and was not charged extra for guacamole. The Daily Nexus could not get a staff member to the scene in time, however, the head elf of the North Pole issued this statement on Mr. Claus‚Äôs behalf:

‚ÄúWe work hard here in the hopes of bringing a bit of magic

to the rest of the world. The quick and selfless action of these

boys shows that there already is magic out there, all you have

to do is look for it.‚Äù

‚Äì Minnie Parson,¬†Head Elf ¬†

Santa‚Äôs Workshop, LLC

Despite the incident, the workshop is on track to complete all necessary repairs in addition to all the toys required for next year‚Äôs run.

¬†

Emily is a linguistics major that believes in the power of magic and that of Freebirds steak quesadillas.

Print

articles.title: Sorority Sally‚Äôs Top 10 All-Time Favorite Christmas Songs
articles.description: Before you begin wondering why there‚Äôs no Mariah Carey or Michael Bubl√© included on this list, you have to remember that these are my favorite Christmas songs.
articles.content:
Before you begin wondering why there‚Äôs no Mariah Carey or Michael Bubl√© included on this list, you have to remember that these are my favorite Christmas songs. In no way did I mention that they had to be the overplayed mall tunes that you won‚Äôt be able to get out of your head post-Christmas-shopping. And they definitely don‚Äôt need to be these ‚Äúclassic‚Äù tales about snowmen dying or reindeers that need nose jobs.

¬†

  1. ¬†¬†¬†¬†‚ÄúMistletoe‚Äù by Justin Bieber

Courtesy of weheartit.com

Though my grandmother may wonder why he ‚Äúnever pulls up his pants‚Äù and thinks he ‚Äúhas too many tattoos,‚Äù I‚Äôve never fallen off the Bieb-waggon. In fact, I think I like him more now than I did when this song came out, and this song is pretty great. Sorry, Grandma.

¬†

  1. ¬†¬†¬†¬†‚ÄúMary, Did You Know?‚Äù by Pentatonix

Courtesy of headlineplanet.com

Try to tell me you haven‚Äôt attempted singing all five parts of this harmony simultaneously while staring at yourself in the mirror. If you seriously haven‚Äôt, you should.

¬†

  1. ¬†¬†¬†¬†‚ÄúLast Christmas‚Äù by Taylor Swift

Courtesy of tumblr.com

Oh, Taylor, how I long for the days when you were young and innocent. Yet, you still sing about boys breaking your heart at every chance you get, somehow even with a Christmas song. Although we all have our questionable opinions about T-Swizzy now, we can still appreciate her country days when we were almost all fans of her and her music.

¬†

  1. ¬†¬†¬†¬†‚ÄúMy Only Wish (This Year)‚Äù by Britney Spears

Courtesy of flickr.com

The only thing better than this 19-year-old Britney classic is the fact that the title needed clarification that this is her only wish this year. Meaning that there will be future, more impossible wishes in years to come. I would love to ask Britney if this method really worked for her; did Santa ever bring you the perfect man?

¬†

  1. ¬†¬†¬†¬†‚ÄúYou Don‚Äôt Have To Be Alone (On Christmas)‚Äù by *NSYNC

Courtesy of popsugar.com

Don‚Äôt remember this song from the Jim Carrey ‚ÄúGrinch‚Äù remake? Neither did I. I‚Äôm like 70 percent positive that it plays during the ending credits. But nothing says Christmas like this classic *NSYNC song that honestly only uses the word ‚ÄúChristmas‚Äù one time during each chorus. It could easily be a song you could play year round. Which I do. Every. Year.

¬†

  1. ¬†¬†¬†¬†‚ÄúSanta Tell Me‚Äù by Ariana Grande

Courtesy of playbuzz.com

Although it took me a few tries to figure out what Ari was saying, this song is still one of the catchiest Christmas songs out there. Besides, it‚Äôs an Ariana Grande song, which means with all the riffs and high notes I can‚Äôt really sing along very well anyway. Knowing the words isn‚Äôt essential for this one.

¬†

  1. ¬†¬†¬†¬†‚ÄúO Holy Night‚Äù by Tori Kelly

Mireya Acierto / Getty Images

Before you wonder where this has been all your life, fear not, because this addition is brand new. I am a firm believer that Tori Kelly can do no wrong and is easily one of the best female vocalists of this generation. When she comes out with more Christmas songs, they may replace this addition, but until then this will serve as a placeholder. Fight me.

¬†

  1. ¬†¬†¬†¬†‚ÄúJingle Bell Rock‚Äù by Bobby Helms

Courtesy of giphy.com

The fact that I had to look up who sang this song probably doesn‚Äôt support the claim that I‚Äôd heard it before ‚ÄúMean Girls.‚Äù

¬†

  1. ¬†¬†¬†¬†‚ÄúCarol of the Bells a.k.a. Opera of the Bells‚Äù by Destiny‚Äôs Child

Courtesy of giphy.com

To find this song, you really have to do some digging. Other than the fact that this version of ‚ÄúCarol of the Bells‚Äù is unique and totally amazing, it adds to the fun that it‚Äôs kind of like a secret. You have to be a true fan of Christmas music and Destiny‚Äôs Child to know about it.

¬†

  1. ¬†‚ÄúMerry Christmas, Happy Holidays‚Äù by *NSYNC

Courtesy of hits92chicago.com

Finally, my absolute favorite Christmas song. To me it is quintessential. Christmas in a nutshell. And, yes, I do have two *NSYNC songs on this list. Just consider yourself lucky that this isn‚Äôt just a tracklist of the entire Home For Christmas album. That album is magical.

¬†

Sorority Sally describes herself as that person you hate that plays Christmas music in July and keeps her lights up year-round.

Print

articles.title: How To Avoid People from High School 101
articles.description: You thought you would never see them again after you threw your cap in the air, but if you go home for the holidays, you are bound to see at least 60 percent of your graduating class at some point.
articles.content:
Courtesy of vidshaker.com

It‚Äôs the time of the year that every college student dreams of after Finals Week: winter break at home. No exams, homemade food and (hopefully) your own room. The only thing that can ruin it? Your high school graduating class. You thought you would never see them again after you threw your cap in the air, but if you go home for the holidays, you are bound to see at least 60 percent of your graduating class at some point. If seeing kids from high school gives you PTSD and makes you feel as if Finals Week was a healthier environment for you, here are some tips on how to easily avoid everyone you used to know.

1. Don‚Äôt go to your local Starbucks

Let‚Äôs be real: Everyone goes to Starbucks, especially when peppermint mochas are out in holiday cups. The last person you want to see in line before you‚Äôve even had your morning joe is Kelsey from art class who raves about how she got into some acting program at some schmancy school. Let‚Äôs also be real: There are probably 10 other Starbucks in a five-mile radius, so not going to the one in your hometown won‚Äôt be so hard. Mobile order will come in clutch here.

2. Don‚Äôt wear your alma mater clothes

I know all you want to wear when you get home are seriously baggy sweatshirts and t-shirts you got throughout your four years. I know you‚Äôre still impressed with how fast you ran in whatever track event that got you that shirt, but just wear it at home. Your mom will be impressed, I promise. That branded high school name is the quickest and easiest way for someone to spot you and maybe even put the pieces together to recognize you. And this tip won‚Äôt just help you avoid ex-peers; moms love talking to kids who went to the same school as their child. Trust me, they WILL ask how college is going, and, trust me, they for some reason don‚Äôt want to hear that you can now shotgun a beer without spilling some on yourself.

3. Go to the gym at odd hours

Everyone and their mother takes the free time over break to get fit and look really good before going back to school. Prime gym times are Saturday/Sunday morning and any weekday before dinner. Try going at 7 a.m. or 2 p.m. on a Saturday when everyone you know is actually living their lives and doing something fun with the friends you want to avoid.

4. Never leave your house

Self-explanatory. Never seeing anyone limits the opportunity to see someone from your past. If anyone questions your motives, just start singing ‚ÄúBaby, It‚Äôs Cold Outside.‚Äù Nothing really brings you into the holiday spirit like 70 degree weather.

5. Pretend you died

Avoid social media and have your mom wear black for most of the break to really sell the fact that you‚Äôre dead. If anyone sees you out and about, they‚Äôll think they‚Äôre going crazy and seeing a ghost. No one wants to attempt to talk to a ghost about how their life is going or if they have a significant other.

Mia Roncati is a second year who totally isn‚Äôt attached to her high school years. (Go Norsemen.)

Print
